bioghist.p: The Philadelphia Orthopaedic Hospital was organized on October 1, 1867, and incorporated on December 2 of that same year. In 1870, an Infirmary for Nervous Diseases was added. The hospital was established to treat patients with bodily deformities or diseases of the nervous system. It accepted charity and paying patients and also treated, at daily clinics, patients not requiring admission. The hospital opened at 15 South 9th Street, then moved to the northwest corner of 17th and Summer streets. On July 1, 1938, it merged with the University of Pennsylvania and became part of the University Hospital. Dr. Gwilym G. Davis, M.D. (1857-1918), was Professor of Orthopedic Surgery and Associate Professor of Applied Anatomy at the University of Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of one volume listing patients and their diagnoses and treatment. A few entries include sketches of limbs or internal anatomical structures, and there is one photograph of a patient's legs and feet.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
